metadata.name: Fluidity #1
metadata.description:
Fluidity is a collection based on a core idea of superimposing flow fields onto color plots created via a supervised machine learning method called support vector machines.  I wanted to see how the combination of these two elements would result in unique and unexpected visual compositions. The patterns in the collection pulsate and dance across the canvas, evoking a sense of movement which is abstract yet organic. 

My hope is that this collection inspires viewers to consider the interplay between artist and technology in creating pieces that can highlight meaningful concepts such as the fluidity of movement, order and chaos, and how complexity can arise from simplicity.

The flow fields within each piece of the collection were generated via Processing 4 and the color plots upon which the flow fields were superimposed were generated using R. Superimposition of both generated outputs was done manually in GIMP.

0xDFCP
